P072648.project_name: Second Health Sector Rehabilitation and Development Project

project_abstract.cdata: The Second Health Sector Rehabilitation and Development Project aims at establishing a cost-effective, and financially sustainable health system, responsive to basic health needs within an integrated policy framework. The project components will: 1) support on-going service delivery, through the provision of technical assistance (TA) to the new district health management teams, in the development, and implementation of district health plans, and, by drawing on support to specialized technical agencies. Basic services, selected high priority activities, pharmaceuticals, and logistics systems will be ensured as part of an essential hospital care; 2) support the improvements needed in the quality of services, through TA namely on standardizing, and enhancing the delivery quality of basic services, which should include as well reproductive health, and communicable disease surveillance, control, and prevention. Additionally, health promotion activities will be developed, to address environmental health issues. Hospital rehabilitation, reconstruction, and/or refurbishing will be implemented as needed, including supply of medical, and laboratory equipment, and a communications network; and, 3) develop, and implement a health sector policy, and management systems, by conducting a demographic, and health survey, and assisting in capacity building for policy formulation. A human resource management strategy will include staff training, while the development of health, and information management will strengthen financial, and administrative processes, to be supported by training, and capacity building.
